author: KtWeav

review: After a bad experience with Apple TV (did not work, since my 50" plasma TV did not have the HDCP security protocol, which most TV's before 2010 or so do not seem to have.  It only worked on my 2 newest TV's that both have Wifi and internet TV built-in already.  Kinda defeats the purpose of buying Apple TV doesn't it...), I tried the Google Chromecast device.  Plugged it in the HDMI port, used the USB port of the TV to power the Chromecast device and 2 minutes later, I was up and running.  Works great as long as you only use one device to transmit video to it (I was using my Iphone 5 and it worked great).  When I also tried streaming with my HP laptop, the device got confused and I had to power it down.  After that it worked great.  If you know this and don't use 2 devices at the same time to try to stream video to the Chromecast, it works wonderfully.  For the low price, I would recommend it to anyone!  I bought 3 of them to get the TV's that don't have internet capability in our house yet, connected to the WWW.

review: A few months ago, my boyfriend saw a commercial for this and he commented it that it looks pretty neat. I thought it was pretty stupid personally because we have tv's, dvd/bueray players, game consoles, tablets, computers, etc. But as he is a hard person to shop for, I decided to order it. I got it on sale with Black Friday for about $5 cheaper than regular price and it was a good choice. He loved it and was the first thing he "played" with after opening presents. Seemed to work to his standards and he loves the fact that whatever you're streaming off of can be in another room. So he was playing a movie off the tablet (Samsung Galaxy 4) on Netflix and the tablet was able to be in another room and someone else was playing with it and he was still able to watch a movie.
